company_profile.name: Inpeco
company_profile.business_description: Global leader in Total Laboratory Automation (TLA) for clinical laboratories. Supplies pre-analytical and post-analytical automation tracks, sample management systems, middleware, and connectivity solutions for IVD analyzers.
products: FlexLab™ X (flagship TLA system — open, scalable, modular)
ProTube™ Suite (sample collection site automation and tube transport)
Pre-analytical modules: centrifuge, decapper, aliquoter, sorter, recapper, archiver
Post-analytical modules: refrigerated storage, high-volume storage (HVS), discarder
company_profile.analyzer_connectivity: 50+ analyzers from 20+ IVD manufacturers across 12 clinical specialties (clinical chemistry, immunoassay, hematology, coagulation, urinalysis, microbiology, molecular, blood gas, serology, HbA1c, thyroid, toxicology)

unbundle.description: Tender covers automation track only. Analyzers and reagents procured separately by the hospital or via parallel tenders.
unbundle.key_check: Verify which analyzers will be installed — must confirm Inpeco connectivity exists or can be developed within project timeline.
unbundle.advantage: Higher flexibility; Inpeco positions as vendor-neutral open platform.

bundle.description: Tender covers automation + analyzers + reagents as a single integrated solution. Inpeco must partner with an IVD manufacturer.
bundle.key_check: Verify if the required analyzer brand has a validated Inpeco connection. Check exclusivity clauses. Assess partner risk.
bundle.advantage: Larger contract value; but more complex commercial and technical responsibility.

showstoppers.name: Proprietary/closed automation system required
showstoppers.description: The tender mandates a specific competitor automation brand or requires a closed system incompatible with Inpeco's open architecture.

showstoppers.name: Required analyzer not in Inpeco connectivity portfolio
showstoppers.description: The tender requires mandatory connection to one or more analyzers that Inpeco does not support and cannot develop within the project timeline.

showstoppers.name: Physical space incompatible with minimum TLA footprint
showstoppers.description: Available laboratory space is too small to accommodate the minimum track configuration required.

showstoppers.name: Mandatory blood bank or life sciences automation (not yet available)
showstoppers.description: The tender requires full blood bank automation as a core deliverable, which Inpeco does not yet offer commercially.

showstoppers.name: Delivery timeline below minimum viable
showstoppers.description: Required go-live date is less than 6 months from contract signature for any TLA system, making delivery technically impossible.
signals: fully operational by [date < 6 months from now]

showstoppers.name: Geographic location outside service coverage
showstoppers.description: The installation site is in a country or region where Inpeco has no service infrastructure and cannot establish it within the project.

showstoppers.name: Bid submission deadline less than 3 weeks away
showstoppers.description: The deadline to submit the bid is less than 3 weeks from now, making it technically or commercially impossible to prepare a compliant and competitive offer.

showstoppers.name: Pre-analytics only scope — no analyzer connectivity required
showstoppers.description: The tender scope is limited exclusively to pre-analytical automation (centrifuge, decapping, aliquoting, sorting) with no connection to analytical instruments. This is not Total Lab Automation and significantly reduces the business case for Inpeco's FlexLab platform.

showstoppers.name: No compressed air allowed on site
showstoppers.description: The site prohibits or does not provide compressed air, which is required by Inpeco's FlexLab pneumatic transport system. Without compressed air the track cannot function.

showstoppers.name: HIL detection and volume measurement via laser vision through tube labels
showstoppers.description: The tender requires hemolysis/icterus/lipemia (HIL) detection and/or liquid level/volume measurement using laser vision technology capable of reading through tube labels. This capability is not part of Inpeco's current product portfolio.

high_risks.name: Brownfield installation — replacement during ongoing operations / no downtime
high_risks.description: The laboratory must remain fully operational with zero or minimal downtime during the entire installation and cutover phase. Requires phased migration planning, temporary workarounds, and close coordination with the lab.

high_risks.name: Turnkey responsibility including third-party analyzers and reagents (bundle)
high_risks.description: Inpeco is contractually responsible for the entire solution including analyzers and reagents from IVD partners. Significant commercial and legal exposure.

high_risks.name: Multi-floor or multi-building installation
high_risks.description: System must span multiple floors or buildings, requiring pneumatic transport or complex inter-floor sample routing not standard in FlexLab. Project complexity and cost escalate significantly.

high_risks.name: High-volume throughput requirements (>5,000 samples/hour)
high_risks.description: Throughput requirements at the upper boundary of FlexLab capacity. Requires careful sizing and may need customized configuration.

high_risks.name: Extensive civil works required
high_risks.description: Significant structural modifications needed (floor reinforcement, new walls, electrical/HVAC upgrade) that fall within scope of responsibility. Increases cost, timeline risk, and interface complexity with third parties.

high_risks.name: Aggressive penalty clauses (>5% contract value)
high_risks.description: Liquidated damages or penalty clauses that could significantly exceed normal project risk tolerance.

high_risks.name: LIS/middleware integration with non-standard system
high_risks.description: Required integration with a hospital LIS, HIS or middleware that Inpeco has not previously interfaced, requiring new development.

high_risks.name: Dismantling and disposal of existing automation system in scope
high_risks.description: Inpeco is required to dismantle, remove, and/or dispose of the existing laboratory automation or pre-analytical equipment. This is typically out of scope and brings logistical, legal (WEEE), and cost risks.

medium_risks.name: Mandatory local presence / regional service office
medium_risks.description: Tender requires a certified local service office or technicians within a defined radius.

medium_risks.name: Specific regulatory / certification requirements
medium_risks.description: Tender requires certifications or regulatory approvals beyond standard CE marking (e.g., country-specific IVD registration, ISO 27001, security certifications).

medium_risks.name: Biobank / automated cold storage connection
medium_risks.description: Requirement for automated cold storage (biobank archiving, refrigerated module) exceeding standard module capacity, or requiring connection to an external biobank system.

medium_risks.name: Anatomical pathology scope included
medium_risks.description: Tender includes automation for anatomical pathology workflow. Inpeco's AP solution is still maturing.

medium_risks.name: Training and qualification requirements are extensive
medium_risks.description: Tender requires formal training programs, IQ/OQ/PQ validation, or certification of operators beyond standard offering.

medium_risks.name: Non-standard or peculiar contract / warranty terms
medium_risks.description: Contract includes warranty periods, SLA requirements, or commercial clauses that differ significantly from Inpeco's standard terms and may require legal review and negotiation.

medium_risks.name: Tablets, PCs, furniture, or accessories out of Inpeco standard scope
medium_risks.description: The tender requires supply of IT equipment (tablets, desktop PCs, monitors), laboratory furniture (benches, chairs, cabinets), or accessories not part of Inpeco's standard product catalog. Sourcing and warranty responsibility for such items must be clearly defined.

medium_risks.name: Service documentation required in specific non-standard languages
medium_risks.description: The tender requires service manuals, technical documentation, or user guides to be provided in a language not currently available in Inpeco's standard documentation package. Translation efforts add cost and timeline risk.

medium_risks.name: IT security certifications required (ISO 27001, IEC 62443, etc.)
medium_risks.description: The tender requires Inpeco or the supplied system to hold IT/cybersecurity certifications such as ISO 27001 or IEC 62443. These certifications may not be in place and obtaining them takes significant time and resources.

medium_risks.name: Rubber-capped tubes — compatibility risk with automated decapping/recapping
medium_risks.description: The laboratory uses tubes with rubber/stopper caps (Vacutainer-style rubber stoppers) that may be incompatible with Inpeco's automated decapper/recapper modules, which are optimized for screw-cap or snap-cap tubes. Requires validation and may need manual workarounds.

medium_risks.name: Physical servers to be supplied and managed by Inpeco
medium_risks.description: The tender requires Inpeco to supply, install, and maintain physical on-premise servers for the automation software. Inpeco's standard offering uses embedded computing or customer-provided IT infrastructure. Server supply adds procurement, logistics, and long-term maintenance obligations.

medium_risks.name: UPS (uninterruptible power supply) included in scope
medium_risks.description: The tender requires Inpeco to supply and integrate an uninterruptible power supply (UPS) system for the automation. UPS supply is typically the responsibility of the hospital/customer facility team. Including it adds procurement, sizing, and maintenance obligations.

medium_risks.name: Ultra-cold storage (-20°C / -80°C) connected to the automation track
medium_risks.description: The tender requires integration with or supply of ultra-cold freezer storage (-20°C or -80°C) connected to the automation track. This is beyond Inpeco's standard refrigerated archiver (+4°C to +10°C) and requires custom engineering or third-party integration.

medium_risks.name: Analyzer connections optional or partial pre-analytics scope
medium_risks.description: The tender describes analyzer connectivity as optional or desirable rather than mandatory, suggesting the customer may not pursue full TLA. This limits the commercial value of the project and may signal a future scope extension risk or a customer not fully committed to TLA.

medium_risks.name: Project manager or service team required to speak a specific language
medium_risks.description: The tender explicitly requires that Inpeco's project manager, application specialists, or service engineers communicate in a specific language (e.g., local national language only). This may constrain resource allocation and staffing options.
